title: Vintage Candle Making
description: Remember melting wax and pouring candles at home? Test your knowledge of this classic 1970s craft!

questions.question: Which type of wax was the most commonly used material for homemade candles in the 1960s and 70s?
What did crafters use as molds for their homemade candles, often recycled from the kitchen?
What material was the wick typically made from?
What was added to melted wax to give candles their color?
options: Wax dye blocks or liquid dye

questions.question: What additive was mixed into paraffin wax to make candles harder and more opaque?
What was a popular candle style in the 1970s that featured multiple layers of different colored wax?
What trendy 1970s candle involved pouring hot wax over crushed ice in a mold to create holes throughout?
What method involved repeatedly dipping a wick into melted wax to gradually build up a tapered candle?
What common kitchen item was used as a double boiler to safely melt wax?
options: A pot inside a pot (or a coffee can in a pot of water)

questions.question: What was added to melted wax to give candles a pleasant smell?
What simple tool was used to hold the wick centered in the mold while wax was poured?
options: A pencil or skewer laid across the top of the mold

questions.question: What type of decorative candle was made by rolling sheets of beeswax around a wick?
What problem occurred when wax cooled too quickly, creating cracks or sinkholes in the candle?
Which popular candle shape, often made in rubber molds, featured animals, flowers, or holiday figures?
What type of wax, produced by bees, was prized for its natural honey scent and golden color?
